attributes.action: Lower VAT for hospitality business, hotel, accommodation and tourism sector
attributes.additional_details:
Most European countries support hotels via low VAT rates:
Austria - 10%, Belgium -12% restaurants and 6% hotels, Bulgaria, Estonia, Ireland, Lithuania, Romania - 9%, Croatia - 13%, Cyprus - 9%, Finland, France, Italy, Spain - 10%, Germany, Malta - 7%, Greece, Netherlands, Portugal - 6%, Latvia - 12%, Luxembourg - 3%, Poland - 8%, Slovenia - 9,5%, Sweden - 13%. Standard VAT rates in these countries are from 17% to 27%.
Source: http://www.vatlive.com/vat-rates/european-vat-rates/eu-vat-rates/
attributes.background: Unfair VAT levels hold back the hotel trade in the UK. The hotel trade is labour intensive. Most hotel expenses are not VAT reclaimable. There is not a lot a hotel can claim VAT back on, unlike the retail trade and manufacturing. VAT is virtually 20% of all a hotel turnover with little reclaimable.
